result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice Franklin Ragin

records.addlTxt: Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 1. Court orders previous conditions to remain in full force and effect.

Defendant Maurice Franklin Ragin in court.  Attorney Angel L Johnson in court for Maurice Franklin Ragin.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense requested Plea hearing date for Deferred Prosecution Agreement. Defense also requested time for Defendant to receive TAD evaluation. State did not object. State requested Justice Point level to be reduced to level 1. Defense did not object. Court ordered Defendants Justice Point level to be modified to level 1. 
Case adjourned for Plea hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 2. Plea hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 9:00 am. Hearing will be held in Room 635 of the Courthouse.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

ADDRESS INFO for Maurice Franklin Ragin
Current: 1216 N 13th street, Milwaukee, WI 53205 United States  (Effective: 08-10-2022)
Prior: 1216 North 13th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53205
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. Court orders previous conditions to remain in full force and effect.

Defense counsel further requests to be heard on bail conditions. Arguments heard. Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. Court orders previous conditions to remain in full force and effect.

Defendant Maurice Franklin Ragin in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials, but are still awaiting an offer from the state. Court adjourns matter for a Status Conference date to Br 02.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Maurice Franklin Ragin in court, appear by video with attorney Angel L Johnson, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with ALL Amazon stores, buildings, employees, grounds in Wisconsin.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Maurice Franklin Ragin in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Maurice Franklin Ragin in custody.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Maurice Franklin Ragin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
